org.flexiblepower.messaging

Interface MessageListener


  • public interface MessageListener
    A MessageListener can be used to sniff messages that are exchanges between Endpoints. To use it, just register a MessageListener in the serivce repository and the runtime should pick it up and provide you with the messages being exchanged. A MessageListener can be annotated by a Filter that limits the type of messages that are received.
    See Also:
    Filter

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void handleMessage(ConnectionManager.EndpointPort from, ConnectionManager.EndpointPort to, java.lang.Object message)
      This handler method is called when a matched message has been exchanged.

    • Method Detail

      • handleMessage

        void handleMessage(ConnectionManager.EndpointPort from,
                 ConnectionManager.EndpointPort to,
                 java.lang.Object message)
        This handler method is called when a matched message has been exchanged.
        Parameters:
        from - The source that sent the message
        to - The destination that has received the message
        message - The message object itself
